text: <a href="../2-Samuel-1-1/" title="2 Samuel 1:1 KJV verse detail"><span id="3" class="versehover">1 Now it came to pass after the death of Saul, when David was returned from the slaughter of the Amalekites, and David had abode two days in Ziklag;

<a href="../2-Samuel-1-2/" title="2 Samuel 1:2 KJV verse detail"><span id="4" class="versehover">2 It came even to pass on the third day, that, behold, a man came out of the camp from Saul with his clothes rent, and earth upon his head: and *so* it was, when he came to David, that he fell to the earth, and did obeisance.

<a href="../2-Samuel-1-3/" title="2 Samuel 1:3 KJV verse detail"><span id="5" class="versehover">3 And David said unto him, From whence comest thou? And he said unto him, Out of the camp of Israel am I escaped.

<a href="../2-Samuel-1-4/" title="2 Samuel 1:4 KJV verse detail"><span id="6" class="versehover">4 And David said unto him, How went the matter? I pray thee, tell me. And he answered, That the people are fled from the battle, and many of the people also are fallen and dead; and Saul and Jonathan his son are dead also.

<a href="../2-Samuel-1-5/" title="2 Samuel 1:5 KJV verse detail"><span id="7" class="versehover">5 And David said unto the young man that told him, How knowest thou that Saul and Jonathan his son be dead?

<a href="../2-Samuel-1-6/" title="2 Samuel 1:6 KJV verse detail"><span id="8" class="versehover">6 And the young man that told him said, As I happened by chance upon mount Gilboa, behold, Saul leaned upon his spear; and, lo, the chariots and horsemen followed hard after him.
<a href="../2-Samuel-1-7/" title="2 Samuel 1:7 KJV verse detail"><span id="9" class="versehover">7 And when he looked behind him, he saw me, and called unto me. And I answered, Here *am* I.
<a href="../2-Samuel-1-8/" title="2 Samuel 1:8 KJV verse detail"><span id="10" class="versehover">8 And he said unto me, Who *art* thou? And I answered him, I *am* an Amalekite.

<a href="../2-Samuel-1-9/" title="2 Samuel 1:9 KJV verse detail"><span id="11" class="versehover">9 He said unto me again, Stand, I pray thee, upon me, and slay me: for anguish is come upon me, because my life *is* yet whole in me.

<a href="../2-Samuel-1-10/" title="2 Samuel 1:10 KJV verse detail"><span id="12" class="versehover">10 So I stood upon him, and slew him, because I was sure that he could not live after that he was fallen: and I took the crown that *was* upon his head, and the bracelet that *was* on his arm, and have brought them hither unto my lord.

<a href="../2-Samuel-1-11/" title="2 Samuel 1:11 KJV verse detail"><span id="13" class="versehover">11 Then David took hold on his clothes, and rent them; and likewise all the men that *were* with him:

<a href="../2-Samuel-1-12/" title="2 Samuel 1:12 KJV verse detail"><span id="14" class="versehover">12 And they mourned, and wept, and fasted until even, for Saul, and for Jonathan his son, and for the people of the LORD, and for the house of Israel; because they were fallen by the sword.

<a href="../2-Samuel-1-13/" title="2 Samuel 1:13 KJV verse detail"><span id="15" class="versehover">13 And David said unto the young man that told him, Whence *art* thou? And he answered, I *am* the son of a stranger, an Amalekite.

<a href="../2-Samuel-1-14/" title="2 Samuel 1:14 KJV verse detail"><span id="16" class="versehover">14 And David said unto him, How wast thou not afraid to stretch forth thine hand to destroy the LORD'S anointed?

<a href="../2-Samuel-1-15/" title="2 Samuel 1:15 KJV verse detail"><span id="17" class="versehover">15 And David called one of the young men, and said, Go near, *and* fall upon him. And he smote him that he died.

<a href="../2-Samuel-1-16/" title="2 Samuel 1:16 KJV verse detail"><span id="18" class="versehover">16 And David said unto him, Thy blood *be* upon thy head; for thy mouth hath testified against thee, saying, I have slain the LORD'S anointed.
<a href="../2-Samuel-1-17/" title="2 Samuel 1:17 KJV verse detail"><span id="19" class="versehover">17 And David lamented with this lamentation over Saul and over Jonathan his son:

<a href="../2-Samuel-1-18/" title="2 Samuel 1:18 KJV verse detail"><span id="20" class="versehover">18 (Also he bade them teach the children of Judah *the use of* the bow: behold, *it is* written in the book of Jasher.)
<a href="../2-Samuel-1-19/" title="2 Samuel 1:19 KJV verse detail"><span id="21" class="versehover">19 The beauty of Israel is slain upon thy high places: how are the mighty fallen!

<a href="../2-Samuel-1-20/" title="2 Samuel 1:20 KJV verse detail"><span id="22" class="versehover">20 Tell *it* not in Gath, publish *it* not in the streets of Askelon; lest the daughters of the Philistines rejoice, lest the daughters of the uncircumcised triumph.

<a href="../2-Samuel-1-21/" title="2 Samuel 1:21 KJV verse detail"><span id="23" class="versehover">21 Ye mountains of Gilboa, *let there be* no dew, neither *let there be* rain, upon you, nor fields of offerings: for there the shield of the mighty is vilely cast away, the shield of Saul, *as though he had* not *been* anointed with oil.

<a href="../2-Samuel-1-22/" title="2 Samuel 1:22 KJV verse detail"><span id="24" class="versehover">22 From the blood of the slain, from the fat of the mighty, the bow of Jonathan turned not back, and the sword of Saul returned not empty.

<a href="../2-Samuel-1-23/" title="2 Samuel 1:23 KJV verse detail"><span id="25" class="versehover">23 Saul and Jonathan *were* lovely and pleasant in their lives, and in their death they were not divided: they were swifter than eagles, they were stronger than lions.

<a href="../2-Samuel-1-24/" title="2 Samuel 1:24 KJV verse detail"><span id="26" class="versehover">24 Ye daughters of Israel, weep over Saul, who clothed you in scarlet, with *other* delights, who put on ornaments of gold upon your apparel.

<a href="../2-Samuel-1-25/" title="2 Samuel 1:25 KJV verse detail"><span id="27" class="versehover">25 How are the mighty fallen in the midst of the battle! O Jonathan, *thou wast* slain in thine high places.

<a href="../2-Samuel-1-26/" title="2 Samuel 1:26 KJV verse detail"><span id="28" class="versehover">26 I am distressed for thee, my brother Jonathan: very pleasant hast thou been unto me: thy love to me was wonderful, passing the love of women.
<a href="../2-Samuel-1-27/" title="2 Samuel 1:27 KJV verse detail"><span id="29" class="versehover">27 How are the mighty fallen, and the weapons of war perished!
